org.svvrl.goal.core.aut

Class RandomAutomaton<T extends Automaton>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.RandomAutomaton<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of generated automata
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    RandomFSA, RandomGame

    public abstract class RandomAutomaton<T extends Automaton>
extends java.lang.Object
    This is a generator of random automata.
    Author:
    Ming-Hsien Tsai

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  RandomAutomaton.GenerationModel
      This enumeration defines two generation model.

    • Method Detail

      • isDeterministic

        public boolean isDeterministic()
        Returns true if the generated automata are syntactically deterministic.
        Returns:
        true if the generated automata are syntactically deterministic

      • setDeterministic

        public void setDeterministic(boolean b)
        Sets true if the generated automata should be syntactically deterministic. If the argument is true, this method will disable the option of counting the number of states after reducing unreachable and dead states and the option of counting the number of states after simplification by simulation.
        Parameters:
        b - true if the generated automata should be syntactically deterministic

      • setStateSize

        public void setStateSize(int i)
        Sets the state size of the generated automaton.
        Parameters:
        i - the state size of the generated automaton

        i - the alphabet size, which should be non-negative

      • setTransitionProbability

        public void setTransitionProbability(double d)
        Sets the probability of creating transitions from a source state to a destination state. The probability is between 0 and 1.
        Parameters:
        d - the probability of creating a transition

      • setReduce

        public void setReduce(boolean b)
        Sets true if the number of states is counted after removing unreachable and dead states, that is, the state size denotes the number of live states.
        Parameters:
        b - true if the state size is counted after removing unreachable and dead states

      • createAutomaton

        protected abstract T createAutomaton(AlphabetType type,
                                     Position position)
        Creates a new automaton.
        Parameters:
        type - the alphabet type of the created automaton
        position - the label position of the created automaton
        Returns:
        an empty automaton with the specified alphabet type and label position

      • random

        public T random()
         throws MaximumRetryException,
                UnsupportedException
        Generates a random finite state automaton.
        Returns:
        a finite state automaton generated randomly
        Throws:
        MaximumRetryException - if the maximal number of trials is reached but the transition density or the acceptance density cannot be satisfied
        UnsupportedException - if the type of the acceptance condition is not supported
